question: In distributed system, each processor has its own ___________
options: ['a) local memory', 'b) clock', 'c) both local memory and clock', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option3: c) both local memory and clock

question: If one site fails in distributed system then ___________
options: ['a) the remaining sites can continue operating', 'b) all the sites will stop working', 'c) directly connected sites will stop working', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) the remaining sites can continue operating
option2: b) all the sites will stop working
option3: c) directly connected sites will stop working

question: Network operating system runs on ___________
options: ['a) server', 'b) every system in the network', 'c) both server and every system in the network', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option2: b) every system in the network
option3: c) both server and every system in the network

question: Which technique is based on compile-time program transformation for accessing remote data in a distributed-memory parallel system?
options: ['a) cache coherence scheme', 'b) computation migration', 'c) remote procedure call', 'd) message passing']

question: Logical extension of computation migration is ___________
options: ['a) process migration', 'b) system migration', 'c) thread migration', 'd) data migration']

question: Processes on the remote systems are identified by ___________
options: ['a) host ID', 'b) host name and identifier', 'c) identifier', 'd) process ID']

question: Which routing technique is used in a distributed system?
options: ['a) fixed routing', 'b) virtual routing', 'c) dynamic routing', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: In distributed systems, link and site failure is detected by ___________
options: ['a) polling', 'b) handshaking', 'c) token passing', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: The capability of a system to adapt the increased service load is called ___________
options: ['a) scalability', 'b) tolerance', 'c) capacity', 'd) none of the mentioned']
